DOC.brief_summary: Research study to determine the proportion of cases in which an interscalene brachial plexus nerve block produces hand and forearm anesthesia.
DOC.brief_title: Effects of Interscalene Brachial Plexus Nerve Blocks on the Hand and Forearm
DOC.detailed_description: This is a research study to prospectively determine the proportion of cases in which an interscalene brachial plexus nerve block produces hand and forearm anesthesia. The investigators will investigate this issue in patients having shoulder and not hand/forearm surgery. We will test hand grip strength and sensation to determine if the hand and forearm are responding to the anesthesia.
DOC.criteria: 18 years of age or older unilateral orthopedic shoulder surgery already desiring an interscalene brachial plexus nerve block for postoperative analgesia with the anesthetic plan including a preoperative interscalene nerve block with mepivacaine any known contraindication to study medications or testing hand grip strength pre/postop insulindependent diabetes mellitus neuropathy of any etiology in the affected extremity any anticipated incision site apart from the shoulder Obesity Pregnancy Incarceration inability to communicate with the investigators and hospital staff
